file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 25-10-01-04 - LATERAL SUNSHADE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL LATERAL SUNSHADE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH LATERAL SUNSHADES 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the LH/RH sunshades. B. The procedures for removal and installation of the sunshades are the same for LH and RH sides. C. The sunshades are installed in the cockpit direct-vision windows in zones 223 and 224. D. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY AIRCRAFT WITH LAT- 25-10-01-000-801-A LATERAL SUNSHADES - REMOVAL ERAL SUNSHADES AIRCRAFT WITH LAT- 25-10-01-400-801-A LATERAL SUNSHADES - INSTALLATION ERAL SUNSHADES EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 25-10-01 Page 1 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-10-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH LATERAL SUNSHADES 2. LATERAL SUNSHADES - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to remove the LH/RH sunshades. B. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit H. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the sunshade (1) as follows: NOTE: The removal of LH and RH sunshades are the same. (a) Carefully, remove the holder (6) from the bracket (5) to release the upper winding pole (7). Refer to DET. D. (b) Carefully, move down the upper winding pole (7) to the lower winding pole (2). Refer to DET. D and DET. C. CAUTION: MAKE SURE THAT THE SUNSHADE (1) WAS MOVED TO THE FULLY CLOSED POSITION. (c) Remove the screws (4) and washers (3) that attach the lower winding pole (2) to the cockpit direct-vision windows. Refer To DET. C. (d) Remove the sunshade (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 25-10-01 Page 2 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH LATERAL SUNSHADES Lateral Sunshades - Removal/Installation Figure 401 B B A ZONES 223 224 DET. A D 2. LOWER WINDING POLE 1. SUNSHADE 3. WASHER C 4. SCREW DET. C C COCKPIT DIRECT-VISION WINDOW (REF.) DET. B (TYPICAL) 5. BRACKET 6. HOLDER 7. UPPER WINDING DET. D POLE 145AMM252526.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 25-10-01 Page 3 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-10-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH LATERAL SUNSHADES 3. LATERAL SUNSHADES - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the LH/RH sunshades. B. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit H. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Install the sunshade (1) as follows: NOTE: The installation of LH and RH sunshades are the same. CAUTION: MAKE SURE THAT THE SUNSHADE (1) IS IN THE FULLY CLOSED POSITION. (a) Tighten the screws (4) and washers (3) to attach the lower winding pole (2) to the cockpit direct-vision windows. Refer To DET. C. (b) Carefully lift the holder (6) to move up the upper winding pole (7). Refer to DET. D. (c) Attach the holder (6) to the bracket (5). Refer to DET. D.
